metadata.Title: CVE-2020-6829 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
When performing EC scalar point multiplication, the wNAF point multiplication algorithm was used; which leaked partial information about the nonce used during signature generation. Given an electro-magnetic trace of a few signature generations, the private key could have been computed. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 80 and Firefox for Android < 80.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-6829` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libnss3 - 2:3.28.4-0ubuntu0.14.04.5+esm7
libnss3-1d - 2:3.28.4-0ubuntu0.14.04.5+esm7
libnss3-nssdb - 2:3.28.4-0ubuntu0.14.04.5+esm7
libnss3-tools - 2:3.28.4-0ubuntu0.14.04.5+esm7
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: firefox: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
nss package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:3.28.4-0ubuntu0.14.04.5+esm7').
